items.title: Joseph McNeil, Young Spark in a Civil Rights Battle, Dies at 83
items.summary: He and his classmates from a historically Black college in Greensboro, N.C., desegregated a Woolworth’s lunch counter in 1960, inspiring similar protests across the nation.

items.title: What We Know About Trump’s Crime and Immigration Crackdown Across the U.S.
items.summary: The president has sent soldiers and federal agents to some cities, and promised to do the same in others, prompting lawsuits and stirring outrage among local leaders.

items.title: Trump Administration Threatens Abrego Garcia With Deportation to El Salvador
items.summary: A court had ruled that Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia could not be sent back to his homeland, but now the administration sees a legal loophole.

items.title: BART Trains Shut Down for the Morning Commute in the Bay Area
items.summary: Bay Area Rapid Transit suffered a systemwide outage for the second time in four months because of a computer problem.

items.title: The Return of the ‘War Department’ Is a Message From Trump
items.summary: President Trump and his defense secretary say they want to return to the era when America won wars. They largely ignore the greatest accomplishment of the past 80 years: avoiding superpower conflict.

items.title: South Koreans Swept Up in Immigration Raid at Hyundai E.V. Plant in Georgia
items.summary: They were among nearly 500 workers apprehended at a construction site for a South Korean battery maker, officials said. The episode prompted diplomatic concern in Seoul.

items.title: Most of 475 people arrested by US immigration agents at Georgia Hyundai facility are Korean nationals – live
items.summary: <p>Ice’s investigative arm executed the warrant as part of an ongoing criminal investigation, homeland security spokesperson tells Reuters</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/05/immigration-ice-raid-hyundai-georgia">Hundreds of workers detained in major Ice raid at US Hyundai factory</a></p></li></ul><p><strong>Tensions between Michelle Wu, the mayor of Boston, and the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/trump-administration">Trump administration</a> have been escalating in recent months over the administration’s aggressive immigration policies, with reports now signaling the possibility of a federal immigration enforcement surge in the city.</strong></p><p>The friction came to a head last week when the Trump administration reportedly began preparing an “immigration enforcement blitz” for Boston in the coming weeks, according to <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2025/08/29/trump-admin-plans-immigration-enforcement-surge-in-boston-00536276">Politico</a>.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/sep/05/donald-trump-pentagon-department-of-war-immigration-tariffs-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: At least 475 workers detained in major Ice raid at US Hyundai factory
items.summary: <p>South Korea concerned after hundreds were arrested at Georgia work site making batteries for Hyundai and Kia cars</p><p>Hundreds of workers at a factory being built in <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/state-of-georgia">Georgia</a> to make car batteries for Hyundai and Kia electric vehicles were detained in a huge raid by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (<a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/ice-us-immigration-and-customs-enforcement">Ice</a>) on Thursday that stopped construction.</p><p>The facility is part of what would be the biggest industrial investment in the state’s history and had been hailed as a huge boost for the economy by Georgia’s Republican governor, Brian Kemp.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/05/immigration-ice-raid-hyundai-georgia">Continue reading...</a>
